Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2007 11:28PM musi wrote: Yes. I had one several years ago when I had a some pain and a few drops of blood coming from a nipple. As I recall, the radiologist sticks a tiny catheter in the duct, then takes a mammogram. There is some pain, but it is tolerable. I ended up having out-patient surgery to remove the duct. Fortunately, it turned out to be a benign papilloma. Maybe you could ask your doctor for some Valium or somthing similar before you have the ductogram. . .
Posts.Title: Ductogram; has anyone had this evejones gene2006
